info.title: HashiCorp Cloud Platform Consul Global Network Manager Service

parameters.name: cluster_resource_name
parameters.description: Cluster Resource Name will be of the form `consul/project/<project_id>/cluster/<cluster_id>`

parameters.name: service_name
parameters.description: The `name` of the service.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: Query param filter: `partition` of the service.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Query param filter: `namespace` of the service.

parameters.name: cluster_resource_name
parameters.description: Cluster resource name will be of the form `consul/project/<project_id>/cluster/<cluster_id>`

parameters.name: service_name
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the service instance.

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results per page to return. If the number 
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero causes `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: pagination.next_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this parameter to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: pagination.previous_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this parameter to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Query param filter: `namespace` of the service.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: Query param filter: `partition` of the service.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to filter by. Searches across `id` and `tags`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Query param filter: `status` of the service. This can be combination of `passing`, `warning`, `critical`, `none`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Sorts the services based on a field. Allowed fields: id, health.
The value needs to be of the format `<Field Name> {asc/desc}` For example: `id`, `id asc`, `health desc`.

parameters.name: cluster_resource_name
parameters.description: Cluster resource name will be of the form `consul/project/<project_id>/cluster/<cluster_id>`

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results per page to return. If the number 
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent

parameters.description:

the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sorts the services based on a field. Allowed fields: `name`, `health`. The value needs to be of the format <{name/health} {asc/desc}> For example: `name asc`, `health desc`.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: Query param filter: `partition` of the service.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Query param filter: `namespace` of the service.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Query param filter: `status` of the service. This can be combination of `passing`, `warning`, `critical`, `none`.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Query param filter: `kind` of the service. This can be combination of `typical`, `connect-proxy`, `destination`, `api-gateway`, `ingress-gateway`, `terminating-gateway`, `mesh-gateway`.

parameters.name: in_mesh
parameters.description: Query param filter: whether the service is in the service mesh or not. Possible values: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: mtls_mode
parameters.description: Query param filter: mTLS mode of the service. Possible value: `permissive`, `strict`.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to filter by. Searches across service `name`, `cluster_id`, `partition`, `namespace`, `sameness_group`, `tags`

parameters.name: external_sources
parameters.description: Query param filter: `external_sources`. Returns a service when service's external sources overlap with the external sources specified.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Query param filter: `tags`.

get.summary:
GetAggregateServiceSumamry returns a summary of all the service instances.
Callers should use the response's AggregateServiceSummaryByKind field that keys service summaries by service kind.

parameters.name: location.project_id
parameters.description: project_id is the projects id.

parameters.name: location.region.provider

parameters.name: filter.clusters
parameters.description: filters summaries to the provided cluster names. If empty, all are included

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of clusters to limit the response to

 - TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: unspecified type to filter on. If this error appears, default to self-managed clusters
 - TYPE_ALL: all cluster types
 - TYPE_SELF: self-managed clusters
 - TYPE_HCP: HCP-managed clusters

parameters.name: location.organization_id
parameters.description: organization_id is the id of the organization.

parameters.name: location.project_id
parameters.description: project_id is the projects id.

id.title: id is the user settable GNM cluster name

region.description:
region is the region that the resource is located in. It is
optional if the object being referenced is a global object.

location.title: location is the location of the cluster with an optional provider and region

existing_cluster.title: existing_cluster indicates whether or not the cluster existed before creation (for linking)

source.title: source is the runtime type for the cluster

consul_access_level.title:
consul_access_level is an optional field to configure the access level that
CCM will have to manage the Consul cluster. When unspecified, it will
default to a value depending on how other request parameters; most likely
GLOBAL_READ_WRITE, since GLOBAL_READ_ONLY needs to be specifically indicated

management_token.title:
management_token is an optional field to set a user-submitted management
token that CCM will use manage the Consul cluster. When empty, we will
auto-generate a management token for the cluster

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id is the user settable GNM cluster name of the cluster to update

region.description:
region is the region that the resource is located in. It is
optional if the object being referenced is a global object.

location.title:
location is the location of the cluster to update with an optional provider
and region

update_mask.title: update_mask is the mask of fields to update

consul_access_level.title: consul_access_level is a cluster field to update

management_token.title: management_token is a cluster-related field to update

schema.description:
UpdateClusterRequest contains the individual fields of the cluster to update.
Fields are added to the request object as they are supported.

The request does not contain the `Cluster` object itself since there are
cluster fields we want to support updateing but do not want to expose
publically in other APIs that also use `Cluster` i.e. we do not want to
add `Cluster.management_token` and start returning the management_token in
the GetCluster API.

get.summary: ListClustersWithDialerEligibility returns the list of clusters along with whether they are eligible to be the dialer in a peering connection.

parameters.name: location.organization_id
parameters.description: organization_id is the id of the organization.

parameters.name: location.project_id
parameters.description: project_id is the projects id.

parameters.name: location.region.provider
parameters.description: provider is the named cloud provider ("aws", "gcp", "azure")

parameters.name: location.region.region
parameters.description: region is the cloud region ("us-west1", "us-east1")

parameters.name: acceptor_cluster_id
parameters.description:
acceptor_cluster_id is the user settable GNM cluster name of the acceptor cluster to
check eligibility with

parameters.name: acceptor_cluster_partition_name
parameters.description:
acceptor_cluster_partition_name is the name of the partition of the acceptor cluster to
check eligibility with

parameters.name: location.organization_id
parameters.description: organization_id is the id of the organization.

parameters.name: location.project_id
parameters.description: project_id is the projects id.

acceptor.description:
acceptor is the token generator for the peering start process. The peer_name and peer_meta
of this peer will be used by all the dialers to identify the connection to the acceptor. In the
future we may provide a field/fields on the Peer to allow overrides of the peer_name so that they can
overide each individual dialer to have a different peer_name or peer_meta.

dialers.description:
dialers will take the token generated by the acceptor and dial back to the acceptor to establish
the peering. The acceptor will use each dialer's peer_name and peer_meta when generating a token.
Likewise the dialer will take the acceptor's peer_name and peer_meta when dialing back to the cluster.

region.description:
region is the region that the resource is located in. It is
optional if the object being referenced is a global object.

location.title: location is the location where the peering connection should be created

parameters.description: provider is the named cloud provider ("aws", "gcp", "azure")

parameters.name: location.region.region
parameters.description: region is the cloud region ("us-west1", "us-east1")

get.summary:
ListPeersByClusterPartition returns the list of cluster partitions, each containing their respective lists of cluster peers.
If a cluster_id is supplied, this endpoint returns the list of cluster partitions only for the specified cluster.

parameters.description:
cluster_id is the user settable GNM cluster name. If supplied, only peering connections
belonging to the cluster in the specified location are returned.

parameters.name: filter.name_substr
parameters.description: name_substr matches summaries that contain a case-insensitive substring in their service name

parameters.name: filter.clusters
parameters.description: clusters matches summaries on the cluster name

parameters.name: filter.partitions
parameters.description: partitions matches summaries on the partition name

parameters.name: filter.namespaces
parameters.description: namespaces matches summaries on the namespace name

parameters.name: filter.kinds
parameters.description:
kinds matches service kind. If empty, this defaults to all kinds

 - KIND_UNSPECIFIED: The default, unspecified service kind. Kind unknown.
 - KIND_TYPICAL: A typical, classic Consul service.
 - KIND_CONNECT_PROXY: A Connect proxy instance.
 - KIND_MESH_GATEWAY: A mesh gateway service instance.
 - KIND_TERMINATING_GATEWAY: A terminating gateway service instance.
 - KIND_INGRESS_GATEWAY: An ingress gateway service instance.
 - KIND_DESTINATION: A Destination  for the Connect feature.
 - KIND_API_GATEWAY: An API gateway service instance

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

google.rpc.Status.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

page_size.description:
The maximum number of results per page to return. If the number 
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned, which you can use to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero causes `page_size` to be defaulted.

next_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this parameter to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

previous_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this parameter to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRequest.description: PaginationRequest are the parameters for a paginated list request.

next_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the next page of results for list requests.
If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`next_page_token` as a value for the query parameter `next_page_token` in
the next request. The value becomes empty when there are no more pages.

previous_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the previous page of results for list
requests. If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`previous_page_token` as a value for the query parameter
`previous_page_token` in the next request. The value becomes empty when
there are no more pages.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRespons.description:
PaginationResponse is the response holding the page tokens for a paginated
list response.

name.title: name is the name of the consul admin partition

description.title: description is the description of the consul admin partition

name.title: name is the name of the consul admin partition

description.title: description is the description of the consul admin partition

ineligibility_reasons.description:
ineligibility_reasons is a list of reasons why this particular partition is ineligible for peering.
Empty list means the partition is eligible.

servers.title: servers is the configuration and TLS status of each consul server in a cluster

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description: AggregateServiceSummary is a summary service count, service instance count, and the health of the service instances.

cert_name.description: cert_name is the Subject.CommonName of the certificate.

cert_serial.description: cert_serial is the Serial Number of the certificate.

cert_expiry.description: cert_expiry is the expiration (NotAfter) date of the certificate.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description: CertificateMetadata contains metadata about an x.509 certificate.

active_server_count.title: active_server_count is the number of servers that have checked in and are reported as running

resource_id.title: resource_id is the unique identifier for the cluster

resource_link_url.title: resource_link_url is the location.Link encoded as a url including the organization, project, type and ID

hcp_managed.title: whether this Consul cluster is managed by HCP

existing_cluster.title: whether this is an existing self-managed cluster

created_at.description: `created_at` is the timestamp when the cluster was first created.

licensing.title: licensing is the Consul licensing information

consul_access_level.title: consul_access_level is the level of access CCM has to the Consul cluster

trust_domain.description:
trust domain is a globally unique UUID that clusters set for themselves. We use this
to tell clusters apart based on Envoy labels which include it in their "consul_destination_trust_domain".

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
- CONSUL_ACCESS_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED: the access level is unspecified
 - CONSUL_ACCESS_LEVEL_GLOBAL_READ_ONLY: CCM has global-read-only access to the Consul cluster
 - CONSUL_ACCESS_LEVEL_GLOBAL_READ_WRITE: CCM has global-read-write access to the Consul cluster

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- STATE_UPDATING: UPDATING should remain the default and generically used state.
If no custom status required, people should stick with UPDATING
rather than proliferating UPDATING_* without an explicit need
 - STATE_UPDATING_TOKEN: UPDATING_TOKEN is an edge-case of UPDATING intended to be used so
that frontend can display a custom status for it.
 - STATE_UPDATING_ACCESS_LEVEL: STATE_UPDATING_ACCESS_LEVEL is an edge-case of UPDATING intended to be
used so that frontend can display a custom status for it.

id.title: id is the name of the cluster

bootstrap_expect.title: bootstrap_expect is the number of consul servers that is expected to join a quorum

gossip_key.title: gossip_key is the consul gossip key for bootstrapping the configuration. Should we move this into a Secrets message?

server_tls.description: server_tls is the public key, private key and certificate_authorities for bootstrapping consul RPC TLS.

consul_config.description: consul_config is the embedded consul configuration. It will always return valid JSON.

management_token.description: management_token is the management token for this cluster.

peering_connection_location.title: peering_connection_location is the location of the GNM peering connections

peering_connection_id.title: peering_connection_id is the slug ID of the GNM peering connection

peer_name.title: peer_name is the name of the peer

peer_cluster_location.title: peer_cluster_location is the location of the peer GNM cluster

peer_cluster_id.description: peer_cluster_id is the user settable GNM cluster name of the peer.

peer_partition_name.title: peer_partition_name is the name of the admin partition on the peer cluster

peering_status.title: peering_status is the state of this individual peer

last_heartbeat_timestamp.description: last_heartbeat_timestamp is the timestamp the last heartbeat was received from this peer cluster/partition.

imported_services_count.title: imported_services_count is the total number of services imported from the peer cluster/partition

exported_services_count.title: exported_services_count is the total number of services exported to the peer cluster/partition

display_error.title: display_error is an error to give to the front end to determine on-going issues for customers

peering_connection_status.title: peering_connection_status is the overall status of the peering connection

peer_licensing.title: peer_licensing is the Consul licensing information of the peer GNM cluster

cluster_id.description: cluster_id is the user settable GNM cluster name.

partition_name.title: partition_name is the name of the admin partition on the cluster

peers.title: peers is the list of cluster peers connected to the above cluster and partition

licensing.title: licensing is the Consul licensing information

cluster.description: cluster is the viewable representation of the cluster.

client_id.description: client_id is the oauth client_id used to authenticate consul to global-network-manager. This _may_ move into a separate secrets RPC later on.

client_secret.description: client_secret is the oauth client_secret used to authenticate consul to global-network-manager. This _may_ move into a separate secrets RPC later on.

cluster.title: cluster is the viewable representation of the cluster

clusters.title: filters summaries to the provided cluster names. If empty, all are included

location.title: location is the location of the services with an optional provider and region

total_services.description:
TODO: remove these fields in favor of just returning aggregate_service_summary_by_kind.
aggregate_service_summary_by_kind can be reduced to total fields (which this is currently).

aggregate_service_summary_by_kind.description: aggregate_service_summary_by_kind breaks down service instance health by Service Kind.

api_url.title: URL to access the Consul API

acl_token.title: ACL token required to make request to the consul API through HTTP Proxy

validity_status.title: validity_status is the token's validity status

invalid_reasons.title:
invalid_reasons are the reasons why the token is invalid. If the token
is not invalid (it is valid, unknown, or n/a), this will returned
"unspecified". A token could potentially be invalid for multiple reasons,
so lists all reasons

time_until_expiration.title:
time_until_expiration is the amount of time until the token expires.
If a token has no expiration, returned duration returned will be nil.
Already expired tokens are indicated by TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_DOES_NOT_EXIST

accessor_id.title: accessor_id is the Consul accessor id of the cluster's management token

cluster.description: cluster is the viewable representation of the cluster.

client_id.title: oauth client_id for the consul cluster service principal

client_secret.title: oauth client_secret for the consul cluster service principal

id.title: id is the user settable GNM cluster name of the cluster to update

location.title:
location is the location of the cluster to update with an optional provider
and region

keys.description: keys is a list of OAuthKeys available for the observability service principal for this cluster. This service principal is authorized to write observability data to HCP. The keys are sorted by the created_at timestamp.

resource_link_url.title: resource_link_url is the location.Link encoded as a url including the organization, project, type and ID

name_substr.title: name_substr matches summaries that contain a case-insensitive substring in their service name

clusters.title: clusters matches summaries on the cluster name

partitions.title: partitions matches summaries on the partition name

namespaces.title: namespaces matches summaries on the namespace name

kinds.title: kinds matches service kind. If empty, this defaults to all kinds

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
- LICENSING_UNSPECIFIED: the Consul licensing information is unspecified
 - LICENSING_ENTERPRISE: the cluster has a valid Consul Enterprise license
 - LICENSING_EXPIRED_ENTERPRISE: the cluster has an expired Consul Enterprise license
 - LICENSING_OSS: the cluster is running Consul OSS
 - LICENSING_OSS_FREE_TRIAL: the cluster is running Consul OSS with an active HCP Consul free trial
 - LICENSING_COMMUNITY: the cluster is running Consul community edition
 - LICENSING_COMMUNITY_TRIAL: the cluster is running Consul community edition with an active HCP Consul trial

id.title: id is the user settable GNM cluster name

location.title: location is the location of the cluster with an optional provider and region

server.title: Server is the configuration and TLS status of each consul server in a cluster

pagination.title: Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: unspecified type to filter on. If this error appears, default to self-managed clusters
 - TYPE_ALL: all cluster types
 - TYPE_SELF: self-managed clusters
 - TYPE_HCP: HCP-managed clusters
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: Type limits responses to the specified cluster type

pagination.title: Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests

id.description: id is the user settable GNM cluster name.

partitions.title: partitions are the Consul admin partitions on the cluster

ineligibility_reasons.description:
ineligibility_reasons is the list of reasons why this cluster is ineligible. Empty
list means this cluster is eligible.

hcp_public.title: hcp_public indicates if this is an HCP-managed, public cluster

id.description: id is the user settable GNM cluster name.

partitions.title: partitions are the Consul admin partitions on the cluster

ineligibility_reasons.description:
ineligibility_reasons is the list of reasons why this cluster is ineligible. Empty
list means this cluster is eligible.

connectivity_options.title:
connectivity_options is a list of network connectivity options for the two clusters
involved in the prospective peering connection

pagination.title: Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests
Pagination response containing the page tokens for future requests

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: UNSPECIFIED means network connnectivity is left up to the user
 - HVN_TO_HVN_PEERING: Triggers an automatic peering of two HVNs for connectivity
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
NetworkConnectivity is a list of options for connecting the underlying
network infrastructure

created_at.description: created_at is when the OAuthKey was created.

client_id.description: client_id is the oauth Client ID of the service principal.

client_secret.description: client_secret is the oauth Client Secret of the service principal.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
PartitionPeeringIneligibilityReason indicates a reason why a peering connection is not possible
with a particular partition

server_external_addresses.description:
server_external_addresses contains user-provided addresses to include in the acceptor's peering token.
Typically used to specify load balancers that route external traffic to the Consul servers.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: Peer represents a single side of the peering connection

PeerDialer is used when creating a peering connection in order to specify
options only available to the Dialer peer
PeerState is the state of the peering connection

location.title: location is the location of the peering connection (composite of the org/project)

peering_connection_id.title: peering_connection_id is slug ID of the peering connection

created_at.description: `created_at` is the timestamp of when the peering_connection was created.

updated_at.description: `updated_at` is the timestamp of when the peering_connection was last updated.

network_connectivity.title:
network_connectivity is used to determine how the underlying network
infrastructure is connected

display_error.title: display_error is an error to give to the front end to determine on-going issues for customers

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
PeeringConnectionStatus is the overall, summarized status of the peering connection, as determined by the states
of the individual peers as well as the state of the PeeringConnection

PeeringConnectivityOption indicates an option for establishing network connectivity between two clusters
for the purposes of cluster peering
PeeringIneligibilityReason indicates a reason why a peering connection is not possible

name.title: name is the consul server name

id.title: id is the consul server ID

lan_address.title: lan_address is the local network address of the consul server

gossip_port.title: gossip_port is the Consul serf port

rpc_port.title: rpc_port is the Consul RPC port

min_quorum.title: min_quorum is the minimum number of consul servers needed for a quorum

tls_enabled.description:
tls_enabled is true if consul RPCs are encrypted
Deprecated: Use server_tls.internal_rpc.enabled instead.

tls_expiry.description:
tls_expiry is the date and time that Consul's TLS certificate expires
Deprecated: Use server_tls.internal_rpc.cert_expiry instead.

scada_status.title: scada_status is the scada provider client's current status

failure_tolerance.title: failure_tolerance is the number of nodes remaining that could fail before the cluster loses stability

server_tls.description: server_tls contains information about TLS certificates on the server.

server_tls contains information about the TLS certificates on the Consul
server.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
ServerTLS describe TLS materials that are used to push certificates down to
Consul.

internal_rpc.description:
internal_rpc defines TLS configuration for the net/rpc protocol used
between Consul agents.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description: ServerTLSMetadata is the TLS metadata that Consul server pushes up to GNM.

cluster_id.title: The unique identifier of the Consul cluster the service is registered with

cluster_resource_name.title: V2 resource name for parent cluster

cluster_resource_id.title: V2 resource id for parent cluster

namespace.description: Namespace where the service is deployed.

partition.description: Partition where the service is deployed.

tags.description: Each instance of a service can have its own tags. At the service level, returns a set of all tags of all service instances.

external_sources.description: Union of all the external sources on the service instances.

connect_native.description: True if the service is connect native, meaning that it does not use an Envoy proxy.

connected_with_proxy.description: True if the service is connected to an Envoy mesh proxy.

transparent_proxy.description: Determines whether service traffic is forced to pass through the sidecar proxy.

connected_with_gateway.description: True if the service is connected to a gateway.

mtls_mode.title:
Represents how external service requests are handled with regards to mutual TLS protocol
Possible values: "", "strict", "permissive"

sameness_group.description: A name defined at the admin partition level to help determine if two services are the same.

cluster_id.title: The unique identifier of the Consul cluster the service is registered with

cluster_resource_name.title: V2 resource name for parent cluster

cluster_resource_id.title: V2 resource id for parent cluster

namespace.description: Namespace where the service is deployed.

partition.description: Partition where the service is deployed.

node.title: Consul node the service is registered on

address.description: Service-specific IP address or hostname. If no value is specified, the IP address of the agent node is used by default.

connected_with_proxy.description: True if the service is connected to an Envoy mesh proxy.

status.title:
Represents overall service instance health status as determined by the highest elevated health check
This can be any of "passing", "warning", "critical", "none"

total.title: total service instances for the service after applying any requested filters

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: ServiceSummary is an aggregate summary about the health of a service across one or more clusters

cluster.title: cluster is the ID of the cluster the summary is from

namespace.description: Namespace where the service is deployed.

partition.description: Partition where the service is deployed.

updated_at.title: updated_at is the last time the service entry was updated in the DB

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- KIND_UNSPECIFIED: The default, unspecified service kind. Kind unknown.
 - KIND_TYPICAL: A typical, classic Consul service.
 - KIND_CONNECT_PROXY: A Connect proxy instance.
 - KIND_MESH_GATEWAY: A mesh gateway service instance.
 - KIND_TERMINATING_GATEWAY: A terminating gateway service instance.
 - KIND_INGRESS_GATEWAY: An ingress gateway service instance.
 - KIND_DESTINATION: A Destination  for the Connect feature.
 - KIND_API_GATEWAY: An API gateway service instance
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title:
Kind is the `kind` of the service that was registered in the Catalog.
https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/api-docs/agent/service#kind

cert_issuer.description:
cert_issuer is the Subject.CommonName of the issuer of the server
certificate.

certificate_authorities.title: certificate_authorities is the list of trusted certificate authorities

tls_autorotated.description:
tls_autorotated is true if HCP manages the cluster's TLS certificates,
the active server certificate was issued by the HCP-managed Cluster Signer CA,
and the cluster's Consul version supports automatic rotation of certs.

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_UNSPECIFIED: Token's invalid reason is unspecified because token is not invalid
 - TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_DOES_NOT_EXIST: Token is invalid because it does not exist. Expired tokens are deleted
and therefore do not exist
 - TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_NO_POLICIES: Token is invalid because no policies are applied to it
 - TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_MULTIPLE_POLICIES: Token is invalid because it has more than one policy applied to it
 - TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_INCORRECT_POLICY: Token is invalid because it does not have the expected policy applied to it
 - TOKEN_INVALID_REASON_ACLS_NOT_BOOTSTRAPPED: Token is invalid because the ACL system has not been bootstrapped
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: TokenInvalidReason provides the reason why a token is invalid

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- TOKEN_VALIDITY_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Token's validity is unspecified. This includes when CCM is unable to
successfully request token information from Consul to do the validation
 - TOKEN_VALIDITY_STATUS_NOT_APPLICABLE: Token validity is not applicable when requesting a token that we do not
support validation
 - TOKEN_VALIDITY_STATUS_VALID: Token is valid
 - TOKEN_VALIDITY_STATUS_INVALID: Token is invalid
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: TokenValidityStatus is a token's validity status

trial_status.title: trial_status indicates the current state of the HCP Consul trial for this organization

start_date.title: start_date indicates the start date of the trial, if this is NULL, then the trial has not started

end_date.title: end_date indicates the end date of the trial period

hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.description:
- TRIAL_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: trial status is not specified
 - TRIAL_STATUS_UNSTARTED: trial has not started
 - TRIAL_STATUS_IN_PROGRESS: trial is in progress
 - TRIAL_STATUS_EXPIRED: trial is expired
 - TRIAL_STATUS_INELIGIBLE: organization is ineligible for a trial
hashicorp.cloud.global_network_manager_2.title: TrialStatus is status of an organization's trial

Currently returning an empty response instead of returning the request
 fields with updated values. There are sensitive fields that we may not
 want to return. Returning empty to avoid inconsistencies with returning
 some fields but not others

type.description:
type is the unique type of the resource. Each service publishes a
unique set of types. The type value is recommended to be formatted
in "<org>.<type>" such as "hashicorp.hvn". This is to prevent conflicts
in the future, but any string value will work.

id.description: id is the identifier for this resource.

uuid.description: uuid is the unique UUID for this resource.

location.description: location is the location where this resource is.

description.description:
description is a human-friendly description for this link. This is
used primarily for informational purposes such as error messages.

hashicorp.cloud.location.Link.description:
Link is used to uniquely reference any resource within HashiCorp Cloud.
This can be conceptually considered a "foreign key".

organization_id.description: organization_id is the id of the organization.

region.description:
region is the region that the resource is located in. It is
optional if the object being referenced is a global object.

hashicorp.cloud.location.Location.description: Location represents a target for an operation in HCP.

provider.title: provider is the named cloud provider ("aws", "gcp", "azure")

hashicorp.cloud.location.Region.description: Region identifies a Cloud data-plane region.

bearer.description: Authentication token, prefixed by Bearer: Bearer <token>
bearer.name: Authorization
